snippet: Clint Eastwood's sketch-comedy routine with an empty chair has become a seemingly mandatory (read: worn out) joke here, dropped with as much frequency as the names Michelle or Barack.
abstract: Clint Eastwood's sketch-comedy routine with an empty chair has become a seemingly mandatory (read: worn out) joke here, dropped with as much frequency as the names Michelle or Barack.

byline.original: By MICHAEL BARBARO and ASHLEY PARKER

headline.main: At Democratic Convention, Eastwood Joke Is a Recurring One
